title: Phase 7: Claude Marketplace Integration
description:
Integrate with Claude's marketplace system:

- Parse known_marketplaces.json for available sources
- Delegate installation to 'claude plugin install'
- Check for allbeads-onboarding.yaml in marketplace plugins
- Sync marketplace metadata

Commands:
- ab marketplace list - Show registered marketplaces
- ab marketplace add <url> - Register new marketplace
- ab marketplace sync - Refresh metadata

Integration:
- Use claude plugin install for base installation
- Layer AllBeads onboarding on top
- Track both Claude and AllBeads state

Ref: PRD-01 'Claude Marketplace Integration', 'Registry Philosophy'

title: v0.2: Context Onboarding & Plugin System
description:
Implement PRD-01: Context Onboarding & Distributed Configuration

Goals:
1. Batch onboarding of folders (ab context add ~/Workspace/*)
2. Progressive status tracking (Dry → Wet)
3. Interactive setup wizards
4. Plugin ecosystem with Claude marketplace integration
5. Multi-agent support (Claude, Cursor, Copilot, Aider)
6. Distributed config via git

See: specs/PRD-01-context-onboarding.md

title: Phase 3: Monorepo & Worktree Support
description:
Advanced project structure handling:

Monorepo:
- Detect monorepo structure (packages/, services/)
- Single vs multiple context mode
- Per-package prefix and persona

Worktrees:
- Detect git worktrees and relationships
- Four strategies: Separate, SyncBranch, SharedDB, Hybrid
- ab worktree list/migrate commands
- Conflict resolution when merging databases

Templates:
- ab template create <name> --from=<path>
- ab template apply <name>
- Template YAML format with init/config/files

Ref: PRD-01 'Monorepo Support', 'Git Worktree Support', 'Template System'

close_reason: All Phase 2 tasks completed: Agent Mail with addressing, locking, Postmaster, HTTP server, and TUI inbox

close_reason: Integration tests added (14 tests covering config, graph, cache, mail)

title: Implement plugin architecture
description: WASM-based plugin system for custom integrations (Linear, Asana, Trello). Define plugin API and lifecycle.

title: Phase 1: Core Context Management
description:
Implement basic context tracking commands:

- ab context add <paths...> - Add folders to context
- ab context remove <path> - Remove folder from tracking  
- ab context list - Display folders with status
- Status detection (dry/git/beads/configured/wet)
- Basic configuration storage (~/.config/allbeads/)

Data structures:
- Context, TrackedFolder, FolderStatus, FolderConfig
- DetectedInfo (languages, frameworks, monorepo, worktree)

Ref: PRD-01 'Commands' and 'Data Structures' sections

title: Phase 2: Interactive Setup Wizard
description:
Implement ab context setup <path> interactive wizard:

- Step-by-step setup flow with progress indicators
- Git initialization (if needed)
- Beads initialization with flavor selection:
  - Standard (SQLite + JSONL)
  - JSONL-only
  - Sync branch mode
  - Daemon mode
- Language/framework detection
- Agent persona selection
- Confirmation prompts and error handling

CLI UX:
- Progress bars, multi-select, confirmation prompts
- Error recovery with Retry/Skip/Abort

Ref: PRD-01 'ab context setup' and 'CLI UX Guidelines' sections

title: Implement Rig struct with Builder pattern
description: Rig configuration with path, remote, persona, prefix, auth_strategy. Use builder pattern for construction.

title: Implement GitHub Issues integration
description: GraphQL API integration with GitHub Issues. Discussion thread sync, discovery links via CODEOWNERS.

title: Implement JSONL parser/serializer
description: Parse and serialize beads JSONL format. Handle versioning and backwards compatibility.

title: Phase 5: Plugin Foundation
description:
Core plugin system infrastructure:

- Parse allbeads-onboarding.yaml protocol
- Plugin data structures (PluginOnboarding, PluginStatus, etc.)
- Read Claude's plugin state:
  - ~/.claude/plugins/installed_plugins.json
  - ~/.claude/plugins/known_marketplaces.json
  - .claude/settings.json (enabledPlugins)

Commands:
- ab plugin list - Show installed plugins
- ab plugin info <name> - Plugin details
- ab plugin status <name> - Plugin status
- ab plugin detect - Scan Claude settings

Curated plugin list (YAML, ~20-50 plugins)

Ref: PRD-01 'Plugin System', 'Claude Plugin Infrastructure'

description:
Intelligent plugin recommendations:

Analysis:
- Language detection (file extensions, config files)
- Framework detection (next.config.js, Cargo.toml, etc.)

- Existing plugin patterns

Recommendation engine:

- RecommendationReason enum (LanguageMatch, FrameworkMatch, etc.)

Commands:
- ab plugin recommend - Show suggestions with confidence
- Integration with 'ab context setup' wizard

Ref: PRD-01 'Plugin Recommendations Engine'

title: Phase 4: Distributed Configuration
description:
Git-based config sync across machines:

Commands:
- ab config init --remote=<url> or --gist=<id>
- ab config pull / ab config push
- ab config status

Config structure:
~/.config/allbeads/
├── config.yaml
├── contexts/
│   ├── work.yaml
│   └── personal.yaml
├── templates/
└── .git/

Features:
- Conflict resolution for multi-machine edits
- Private vs public repo handling
- Gist support for lightweight sync

Ref: PRD-01 'Distributed Configuration' section

title: Phase 6: Plugin Onboarding Execution
description:
Execute plugin onboarding steps:

Step types:
- command: Run shell commands
- interactive: Prompt user for input
- template: Render templates with variables
- append: Append content to files

Features:
- Prerequisite checking and installation
- Skip steps based on detection
- Dry-run mode (--dry-run)
- Rollback on failure (optional)

Commands:
- ab plugin install <name> [--dry-run]
- ab plugin remove <name> [--clean]
- ab plugin upgrade <name>
- ab plugin configure <name>

Security:
- Show all steps before execution
- User consent required
- Sandbox to project directory

Ref: PRD-01 'Plugin Onboarding Protocol', 'Security Model'

- ab agent list - Show configured agents
- ab agent init <agent> - Initialize agent config
- ab agent sync - Sync context to all agents
- ab agent preview <agent> - Preview config

Ref: PRD-01 'Multi-Agent Support'
